summary.long: 2 Timothy is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God, according to the promise of life in Christ Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To Timothy, my beloved son: Grace, mercy, and peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I thank God, whom I serve with a clear conscience the way my forefathers did, as I constantly remember you in my prayers night and day,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: longing to see you, even as I recall your tears, so that I may be filled with joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I am mindful of the sincere faith within you, which first dwelled in your grandmother Lois and your mother Eunice, and I am sure that it is in you as well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason I remind you to kindle afresh the gift of God which is in you through the laying on of my hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For God has not given us a spirit of timidity, but of power and love and discipline.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore do not be ashamed of the testimony of our Lord or of me His prisoner, but join with me in suffering for the gospel according to the power of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who saved us and called us with a holy calling, not according to our works, but according to His own purpose and grace, which was granted to us in Christ Jesus from all eternity,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but has now been revealed by the appearing of our Savior Christ Jesus, who abolished death and brought life and immortality to light through the gospel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for which I was appointed a preacher, an apostle, and a teacher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason I also suffer these things; but I am not ashamed, for I know whom I have believed, and I am convinced that He is able to protect what I have entrusted to Him until that day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hold on to the example of sound words which you have heard from me, in the faith and love which are in Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Protect, through the Holy Spirit who dwells in us, the treasure which has been entrusted to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are aware of the fact that all who are in Asia turned away from me, among whom are Phygelus and Hermogenes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord grant mercy to the household of Onesiphorus, for he often refreshed me and was not ashamed of my chains;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but when he was in Rome, he eagerly searched for me and found me—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Lord grant to him to find mercy from the Lord on that day—and you know very well what services he rendered at Ephesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You therefore, my son, be strong in the grace that is in Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The things which you have heard from me in the presence of many witnesses, entrust these to faithful people who will be able to teach others also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suffer hardship with me, as a good soldier of Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No soldier in active service entangles himself in the affairs of everyday life, so that he may please the one who enlisted him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if someone likewise competes as an athlete, he is not crowned as victor unless he competes according to the rules.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The hard-working farmer ought to be the first to receive his share of the crops.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Consider what I say, for the Lord will give you understanding in everything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember Jesus Christ, risen from the dead, descendant of David, according to my gospel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for which I suffer hardship even to imprisonment as a criminal; but the word of God is not imprisoned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason I endure all things for the sake of those who are chosen, so that they also may obtain the salvation which is in Christ Jesus and with it eternal glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The statement is trustworthy:
For if we died with Him, we will also live with Him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If we endure, we will also reign with Him;
If we deny Him, He will also deny us;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If we are faithless, He remains faithful, for He cannot deny Himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remind them of these things, and solemnly exhort them in the presence of God not to dispute about words, which is useless and leads to the ruin of the listeners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be diligent to present yourself approved to God as a worker who does not need to be ashamed, accurately handling the word of truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But avoid worldly and empty chatter, for it will lead to further ungodliness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their talk will spread like gangrene. Among them are Hymenaeus and Philetus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: men who have gone astray from the truth, claiming that the resurrection has already taken place; and they are jeopardizing the faith of some.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, the firm foundation of God stands, having this seal: “The Lord knows those who are His;” and, “Everyone who names the name of the Lord is to keep away from wickedness.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in a large house there are not only gold and silver implements, but also implements of wood and of earthenware, and some are for honor while others are for dishonor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, if anyone cleanses himself from these things, he will be an implement for honor, sanctified, useful to the Master, prepared for every good work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now flee from youthful lusts and pursue righteousness, faith, love, and peace with those who call on the Lord from a pure heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But refuse foolish and ignorant speculations, knowing that they produce quarrels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord’s bond-servant must not be quarrelsome, but be kind to all, skillful in teaching, patient when wronged,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with gentleness correcting those who are in opposition, if perhaps God may grant them repentance leading to the knowledge of the truth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they may come to their senses and escape from the snare of the devil, having been held captive by him to do his will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But realize this, that in the last days difficult times will come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For people will be lovers of self, lovers of money, boastful, arrogant, slanderers, disobedient to parents, ungrateful, unholy,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: unloving, irreconcilable, malicious gossips, without self-control, brutal, haters of good,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: treacherous, reckless, conceited, lovers of pleasure rather than lovers of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: holding to a form of godliness although they have denied its power; avoid such people as these.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For among them are those who slip into households and captivate weak women weighed down with sins, led on by various impulses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: always learning and never able to come to the knowledge of the truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just as Jannes and Jambres opposed Moses, so these men also oppose the truth, men of depraved mind, worthless in regard to the faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they will not make further progress; for their foolishness will be obvious to all, just as was that also of Jannes and Jambres.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now you followed my teaching, conduct, purpose, faith, patience, love, perseverance,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: persecutions, and sufferings, such as happened to me at Antioch, at Iconium, and at Lystra; what persecutions I endured, and out of them all the Lord rescued me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, all who want to live in a godly way in Christ Jesus will be persecuted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But evil people and impostors will proceed from bad to worse, deceiving and being deceived.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You, however, continue in the things you have learned and become convinced of, knowing from whom you have learned them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that from childhood you have known the sacred writings which are able to give you the wisdom that leads to salvation through faith which is in Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All Scripture is inspired by God and beneficial for teaching, for rebuke, for correction, for training in righteousness;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that the man or woman of God may be fully capable, equipped for every good work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I solemnly exhort you in the presence of God and of Christ Jesus, who is to judge the living and the dead, and by His appearing and His kingdom:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: preach the word; be ready in season and out of season; correct, rebuke, and exhort, with great patience and instruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the time will come when they will not tolerate sound doctrine; but wanting to have their ears tickled, they will accumulate for themselves teachers in accordance with their own desires,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they will turn their ears away from the truth and will turn aside to myths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as for you, use self-restraint in all things, endure hardship, do the work of an evangelist, fulfill your ministry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I am already being poured out as a drink offering, and the time of my departure has come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have fought the good fight, I have finished the course, I have kept the faith;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in the future there is reserved for me the crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous Judge, will award to me on that day; and not only to me, but also to all who have loved His appearing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Make every effort to come to me soon;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for Demas, having loved this present world, has deserted me and gone to Thessalonica; Crescens has gone to Galatia, Titus to Dalmatia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only Luke is with me. Take along Mark and bring him with you, for he is useful to me for service.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I have sent Tychicus to Ephesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you come, bring the overcoat which I left at Troas with Carpus, and the books, especially the parchments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Alexander the coppersmith did me great harm; the Lord will repay him according to his deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be on guard against him yourself too, for he vigorously opposed our teaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At my first defense no one supported me, but all deserted me; may it not be counted against them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord stood with me and strengthened me, so that through me the proclamation might be fully accomplished, and that all the Gentiles might hear; and I was rescued out of the lion’s mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will rescue me from every evil deed, and will bring me safely to His heavenly kingdom; to Him be the glory forever and ever. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Greet Prisca and Aquila, and the household of Onesiphorus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Erastus remained at Corinth, but I left Trophimus sick at Miletus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Make every effort to come before winter. Eubulus greets you, also Pudens, Linus, Claudia, and all the brothers and sisters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord be with your spirit. Grace be with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
